content: easy cabled headband i got a sample of this yarn from margaret at mostly merino when i was browsing her booth at the new york state sheep and wool festival at rhinebeck this yarn is wonderful for a headband soft and holds its shape very well i hope you like it yarn remnant less than ½ a skein mostly merino navy needles size 5 you can use any needle circular or double pointed or straight gauge the width of the headband or earwarmer is 2 ¾ and the total length of 18 crossovers is 22 headband cast on 18 sts if you would like a wider headband add extra seed stitches on each side following the chart below make 18 crossovers for a headband approximately 22 long try it on as you go along you ll want it to be tight a note on edge stitches start the row by slipping the 1st stitch knit-wise and purling the last stitch in every row this will create a nice braid effect on both ends once you have completed 18 crossovers or reached the desired circumference stop on row 8 or row 1 of the chart now you will need to join the beginning to the end you have 2 options 1 kitchener stitch you will need to pick up the sts from the cast on row onto a spare needle then sew up the seam 2 mattress stitch in which case you will need to bind off in pattern and then sew up the seam copyright 2012 daria mark the knitting arts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal home use only www theknittingarts com
